thread.title: Kim Jong-un’s nephew turns down Oxford Uni over assassination fears
thread.title_full: Kim Jong-un’s nephew turns down Oxford Uni over assassination fears

title: Kim Jong-un’s nephew turns down Oxford Uni over assassination fears
text:
LAST PHOTO: Kim Jong-nam moments from DEATH as NORTH KOREAN man arrested 
Kim Han Sol’s girlfriend, who uses the name Sonia, already studies at Oxford, according to reports. 
But the pair may be spending some time apart as the young man – who studied politics in Paris for three years before winning the Oxford place – is reluctant to come to Britain. 
Kim Jong-un appears to be trying to wipe out other members of his family in a bid to prevent challenges to his brutal regime. 
He ordered the execution of his uncle, Jang Sung Taek, in 2013. 
Kim Han Sol was born in North Korean capital Pyongyang in 1995. 
But he moved to Macau with his family when his dad was exiled. Inside North Korea: The pictures Kim Jong-un doesn't want you to see Tuesday, 13th December 2016 Since 2008, photographer Eric Lafforgue ventured to North Korea six times. Thanks to digital memory cards, he was able to save photos that was forbidden to take inside the segregated state 1 / 62 Eric Lafforgue/Exclusivepix Medi Taking pictures in the DMZ is easy, but if you come too close to the soldiers, they stop you 
Despite his young age, he could be seen as a potential challenger to his uncle – especially as he has said he wants to go back to North Korea and improve the country. 
In a 2012 interview, he said: ”I have always dreamed one day I will go back and make things better – make it easier for all the people there. 
"I also dream of reunification because it's really sad that I can't go to the other side [South Korea] and see my friends there." Related articles
